sounds

Class MusicPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sounds.MusicPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MusicPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A class of object that plays music.
    Since:
    CAH1.0
    Version:
    CAH1.0
    Implements:
    Runnable
Author:
Holt Maki

    • Constructor Detail

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer()
        Creates a new object that plays music. This music constructor is blank because it simply initializes the TreeMap. Songs are added after the creation of the object if this constructor is used.
        Since:
        CAH1.0
        See Also:
        #MusicPlayer(TreeMap)} for a constructor that can have an already made map added to it.

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,SongInfo> songmap)
        Creates a new music player with an already existing map of songs.
        Parameters:
        songmap - - the TreeMap of the songs.
        Since:
        CAH1.0
        See Also:
        #MusicPlayer()} for a constructor that makes its own map.

    • Method Detail

      • addSong

        protected void addSong(java.lang.String pathname,
           SongInfo info)
        Adds a song to the MusicPlayer
        Parameters:
        pathname - - the path of the song. This method does not have a PathFinder inside it so the path needs to be found outside of the method. (Basically the path given here needs to be a full correct path).
        info - - the songs SongInfo: Contains the data for the songs artist, album, year, etc.
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • playSongs

        private void playSongs(SongProperty aPropertyType,
             java.lang.String selection)
        Plays songs.
        Parameters:
        aPropertyType - - the type of the peoperty that the songs are being sorted by
        selection - - the selection from the property's options (Ex: if the property was artist, this could be 2pac)
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the MusicPlayer.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
